did.unittitle: H. I. Z., Advice and instruction to the Palatines newly arrived in the Province of Pennsylvania
did.physdesc: 1 volume. The "Advice" is tipped in the (blank) book.
did.abstract: In the hand of Benjamin Franklin, "from the manuscript. Translated from the High Dutch."

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Printed in part, and dated: Pennsylvania Magazine...vol.XVI, 16n. Film 54-57 Frame 135

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This humorous piece of advice and instruction for newly arrived Palatines was written "By their Countryman H I Z a Freeholder in the Province." It contains various recommendations and references to individuals with thinly veiled names, such as "If you want a quack that sets up for a skillful Physician send for Dr. K____y." The concluding line recommends to "Drink hard, Laugh loud, + run deeply in Debt" for those who desire to possess a "perfect calmness of Thought, to sleep sound & enjoy a good measure of Health."

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This short piece offers a satirical take on some Philadelphians. Framed as a list of advice for new German immigrants, the piece has a more political tone in which it offers a critical appraisal of some prominent members of society and business. These two pages are in Benjamin Franklinâ€™s hand. Once thought to a work of Franklin's, since 1963, it has been believed that Franklin was not the original author of this piece.
